main event: A military observer spotted a white, round object the size and intensity of a first magnitude star flying at high altitude and very fast speed from southwest to northeast.
interesting points: The object was observed at an elevation of 72 degrees above the horizon.
The object's characteristics were consistent with a possible satellite.
The sighting was reported as a CIRVIS (Communications Instructions for Reporting Vital Intelligence Sightings) report.
The report was distributed to various military and intelligence agencies, including NORAD, the Pacific Air Forces, and the Department of Defense.
The observation lasted for an unspecified duration, but was likely brief given the high speed of the object.
sighted object: white, round object the size and intensity of a first magnitude star
